During the holidays, the best gifts don't always come from a box. If you want to get ahead of the Black Friday shopping rush, Amazon is offering two different ways to save on one of the best music streaming services we've ever tried, with major savings on an always-welcome gift.

Tackle your holiday shopping with deals and expert advice delivered straight to your phone. Sign up for text message alerts from the deal-hunting team at Reviewed.

Through January 10, 2022 , Prime members who purchase select Amazon Echo devices will get six months of Amazon Music Unlimited for free. The streaming service normally costs Prime shoppers $7.99 a month (or $9.99 for non-Prime members), meaning newcomers can save $47.94 over the six months (non-Prime members save $59.94) for access to 75 million songs. That means if you pick up the latest Amazon Echo speaker ($99.99), you can also get a plethora of songs (plus your favorite podcasts) on demand without ad interruption and can even download your favorite tunes onto your phone to listen to offline. 

If they're not in the market for an Echo device, Prime customers can also get access to Amazon Music Unlimited and the Showtime Prime Video channel for 99 cents a month for three months. Access to Showtime usually runs Prime members $10.99 a month, but now you can get that plus the millions of songs available with Amazon Music Unlimited for just $2.97 over 90 days. That's a total savings of $53.97 for access to the hottest hit songs and hit TV shows at the same time. After the trial period, the service will renew at the normal monthly rate, so if you don't want to pay for continued access, make sure you cancel before the promotional period expires.

Whatever deal you pick, you'll be getting one of our favorite music streaming services. On top of its vast song selection, we were impressed with Amazon Music Unlimited's Dolby Atmos Music feature, which expands a song's mix selection for heightened surround and speaker height elements. Anyone with a mobile device compatible with the Amazon Music app and any pair of headphones, along with certain speakers (including the Reviewed-approved $199.99 Echo Studio) can use that feature for a deeper listening experience. 

With the Showtime Prime channel, subscribers can get hundreds of movies and TV shows on-demand through the Prime Video app. This includes cinematic classics like  The Godfather  to new hit shows like  Dexter: New Blood . 

Whether you want to add to your home music experience or get some new media to watch from your couch, you can save big this holiday season through Amazon Music Unlimited. Shop Amazon now and see how you can get more out of streaming.  

Get 6 months of Amazon Music Unlimited with select Echo device purchases.

Get 3 months of Amazon Music Unlimited and Showtime for $2.97 (save $53.97).
